word: Having lost all sense of shame,
parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From apo and algeo; to grieve out, i.e. Become apathetic.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of a and a presumed selges; licentiousness.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From ergates; occupation; by implication, profit, pains.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Uncleanness, impurity. From akathartos; impurity, physically or morally.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Covetousness, avarice, aggression, desire for advantage. From pleonektes; avarice, i.e. fraudulency, extortion.
